solution_line_template: The cost of {num_hamburgers} pieces of hamburger is ${hamburger_price_per_piece} x {num_hamburgers} = $<<{hamburger_price_per_piece}*{num_hamburgers}={cost_hamburgers}>>{cost_hamburgers}.
The cost of {num_fries_sets} sets of French fries is ${fries_price_per_set} x {num_fries_sets} = $<<{fries_price_per_set}*{num_fries_sets}={cost_fries}>>{cost_fries}.
The cost of {num_soda_cups} cups of soda is ${soda_price_per_cup} x {num_soda_cups} = $<<{soda_price_per_cup}*{num_soda_cups}={cost_soda}>>{cost_soda}.
Hence, each of the {num_friends} friends will contribute ${total_bill}/{num_friends} = $<<{total_bill}/{num_friends}={cost_per_friend}>>{cost_per_friend}.
